comments.body: Awesome, although I should have mentioned that for each case I would like to replace only a specific letter, rather than any letter of the alphabet. So in my previous example I would like to replace the letter A/a.
I have indeed used Alan ate an apple in my demo which produces: [bbcode]A[/bbcode]lan [bbcode]a[/bbcode]te [bbcode]a[/bbcode]n [bbcode]a[/bbcode]pple as output. Check demo link again.

thank you anubhava. Sorry I might have given a bad example. Lets say: "Alan ate a banana". It would only replace words starting with A or a. Rather than any letter of the alphabet. Sorry if I wasn't clear enough

answers.body:
Search regex:

(\b[Aa])

Replace by:

[bbcode]$1[/bbcode]

RegEx Demo

Here search regex is: (\b[Aa]) which is matching letter a or A only after a word boundary \b thus matching only the first letter of a word.

title: Replace letter only if found at start of word in c#
body:
I couldn't find a definite answer to this so I am posting a question.

I would like to add some bbcode to letters in every word in my string but only when the letter is found at the start of a string. It should add to both upper and lower case letters at start of words.

For example it would replace:

string s = "Alan ate an apple";

With:

[bbcode]A[/bbcode]lan [bbcode]a[/bbcode]te [bbcode]a[/bbcode]n [bbcode]a[/bbcode]pple

cant' figure out how to achieve this :/
